title: WTA roundup: Kuzmova rallies past U.S. teen
text:
Katie Volynets, a 17-year-old from Northern California, took the first set Monday but couldn't hold on for an upset win over fifth-seeded Viktoria Kuzmova of Slovakia in the first round of the BGL BNP Paribas Luxembourg Open.

Kuzmova emerged with a 6-7 (4), 7-6 (1), 6-1 win.

Volynets won the USTA Billie Jean King Girls 18 National Hard Court Championship this summer to earn a wild-card entry into the U.S. Open, where she fell in the first round to 15th-seeded Bianca Andreescu of Canada. Volynets is ranked 389th in the world.

In other opening-round action, Russia's Margarita Gasparyan rallied past Switzerland's Jil Teichmann 2-6, 7-6 (4), 6-3; and Germany's Tatjana Maria beat the United States' Shelby Rogers 6-3, 1-6, 6-4.

Two Czech Republic players won, with Kristyna Pliskova topping Spain's Aliona Bolsova 6-2, 7-6 (4), and Denisa Allertova sneaking past Luxembourg's Mandy Minella 6-7 (7), 7-6 (5), 7-6 (6).

VTB Kremlin Cup

Sixth-seeded Anastasija Sevastova of Latvia, the only seed in action on the first day of the Moscow event, cruised to a 6-1, 7-5 victory over Belarus' Aliaksandra Sasnovich.

Sevastova saved seven of the nine break points she faced in the 97-minute match, and she converted five of her 12 break chances.

Only two other main-draw matches were contested Monday. The Czech Republic's Karolina Muchova defeated Russia's Svetlana Kuznetsova 6-2, 6-3, and Anna Kalinskaya beat Anastasia Potapova 6-0, 3-6, 6-4 in an all-Russian matchup.

--Field Level Media
description: Katie Volynets, a 17-year-old from Northern California, took the first set  Monday but couldn't hold on for an upset win over fifth-seeded Viktoria  Kuzmova...
